title: Pesto Pasta with Chicken Recipe
description: Easy chicken pesto pasta recipe made with sautéed garlic chicken tossed with bow tie pasta, sun-dried tomatoes, and pesto sauce, ready in 30 minutes.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Chicken Pesto Chicken Recipes Pesto Pasta with Chicken 4.5 (1,085) 741 Reviews 144 Photos This chicken pesto pasta is easy and delicious. Serve with crusty bread and salad for a quick dinner. Use as much or as little pesto sauce as you like. Using homemade pesto will taste even better, but it adds to prep time. Enjoy! Submitted by Kristin Updated on April 24, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 144 144 144 144 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (16 ounce) package bow tie pasta 1 teaspoon olive oil 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces 1 pinch crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste ½ cup pesto sauce ⅓ cup oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, drained and cut into strips Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes; drain. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté garlic until tender. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in chicken and season with red pepper flakes. Cook until chicken is golden and cooked through. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine pasta, chicken, pesto, and sun-dried tomatoes in a large bowl; toss to coat evenly. Add Your Photo Photos of Pesto Pasta with Chicken 01 of 144 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 144 Photo by  DREGINEK 10/24/2024 For how simple this is, and how quickly ut comes together, it was really good!! This is a GREAT weeknight meal! I did some some minced onions - which I started in Step1 and added the garlic the last minute before adding the chicken. I liked the pine nut suggestion so I added them just as the chicken was finished cooking but before adding the pesto - about a TBLS worth. I had the last of my grape tomatoes from my garden to use up so I sliced them and added after the pine nuts and in place of the sun dried tomatoes. Finally, sprinkled some finely shredded Romano cheese over this. All in all, super happy with this and can’t wait to make again! Thanks Kristin! Great recipe! 03 of 144 Photo by  Alyssa Gaudreau 02/02/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Family favorite This was so delicious and simple to make. I added a lot of red pepper because my family enjoys spice. Will definitely make this again! 04 of 144 Photo by  Lpierce 01/24/2024 05 of 144 Photo by  Mitch Marku 01/16/2024 I made my own pesto sauce for this and the meal was delicious! Thanks! 06 of 144 Photo by  Crystal 10/06/2023 Made as directed. But used a protein based low carb pasta, chicken thighs (better flavor for us) that were seasoned with Italian seasoning and a little rosemary. Added an entire 8 oz jar of julienned sun dried tomatoes & the oil and 8oz of pesto. Topped with parm...will be adding to my regular rotation. 07 of 144 Photo by  CurvyBoard7596 08/04/2023 Delicious! I only used 1 chicken breast as I am not a big meat eater. I also added 2 big handfuls of spicy and bitter mixed greens like arugula, mustard greens etc. and let them wilt a bit. Yummy! 08 of 144 Photo by  JHD007 06/28/2023 Very good recipe. I only used 8 oz of pasta, but I used homemade fusilli pasta. It held the sauce nicely. I also used freshly homemade pesto with 2 chicken breasts and the sun dried tomatoes. Great use of excess basil. Will definitely be making again. 09 of 144 Photo by  Colleen Knipfer 05/21/2023 Didn't have bowtie pasta, used fettuccine noodles. Only had a teaspoon of dried tomatoes so added cut cherry tomatoes. It's lovely 🌹 10 of 144 Photo by  vicki936 10/19/2022 I didn't really like this but my husband did. This did make a lot, at least 8 servings. For the leftovers, I added a jar of Bertolli pesto alfredo sauce, some grated Parmesan and the rest of the jar of sun-dried tomatoes. I liked it better this way but not enough to make again. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Pesto Chicken Florentine 1,875 Ratings Teena's Spicy Pesto Chicken and Pasta 485 Ratings Creamy Pesto Chicken and Bow Ties 229 Ratings Penne with Chicken and Pesto 868 Ratings Amazing Italian Lemon Butter Chicken 679 Ratings Lemon Pasta with Chicken 3 Ratings Brian's Chicken Sausage Pesto Pasta 7 Ratings Spicy Chicken Orecchiette 2 Ratings Lemon-Pepper Chicken Pasta 3 Ratings Chicken Milano 2,812 Ratings Easy Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo 158 Ratings Colorful Chicken Pesto with Asparagus, Sun Dried Tomatoes and Peppers 38 Ratings Spence's Pesto Chicken Pasta 144 Ratings Brooklyn Girl's Penne Arrabiata 1,170 Ratings Spicy Chicken Spaghetti II 14 Ratings Buffalo Chicken Pasta 7 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
